text: Espinosa or Espinoza is a Spanish and Portuguese surname. Citing Dictionary of American Family Names, 2013, Oxford University Press. Notable people with the surname include: * Al Espinosa (1891–1957), American golfer * Álvaro Espinoza (born 1962), American baseball coach * Anagabriela Espinoza (born 1988), Miss International 2009 from Mexico * Andrés Espinosa (born 1963), Mexican runner * Angel Espinosa (1966-2017), Cuban boxer * Baruch Spinoza (1632–1677), born Benedito de Espinosa, Jewish-Dutch philosopher of Portuguese Sephardi origin * Chris Espinosa (born 1961), senior employee of Apple Inc * Danny Espinosa (born 1987), American baseball player * Dulce María Espinoza Saviñón (born 1985), Mexican actress musician * Eden Espinosa (born 1978), American singer and stage actress * Giovanny Espinoza (born 1977), Ecuadorian footballer * Helena Espinosa Berea (ca.1895 - ca.1960), Mexican academic * Jerónimo Jacinto de Espinosa (1600–1667), Spanish painter * Juan Bautista de Espinosa (1590–1641), Spanish painter * Juan de Espinosa Medrano (ca. 1629–1688), Peruvian cleric * Léon Espinosa (1825–1903), Dutch dancer * Luis Espinosa (born 1967), Colombian cyclist * Oscar Espinosa Chepe (1940–2013), Cuban economist and dissident * Roger Espinoza (born 1986), Honduran footballer * Rubén Espinoza (born 1961), Chilean footballer ==Fictional characters== * Anna Espinosa, character in Alias. * Carla Espinosa, character in Scrubs. * Julio Espinosa, character from Gran Hotel Spanish television series. *Oscar Espinosa, character from video game Just Cause 4. * Rosita Espinosa, character from The Walking Dead franchise. * Daniel “Dan” Espinoza, character from Lucifer (TV Series) ==References== Category:Spanish-language surnames de:Espinoza nl:Espinoza
title: Espinosa (surname)
